授業目的: The purpose of this course is that students will acquire knowledge and understand global development agenda--an important transition from the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and complex implementation aspects of SDGs, which contains 17 goals and 169 targets adopted by the UN's 193 member states in 2015.
到達目標:
1. Students will be able to assess the transition from MDGs to SDGs.
2. Students will be able to research integrated three policy pillars of “Economics”, “Environment, and “Social” plus governance to implement SDGs.
3. Students will be able to understand the policy direction of UN development system at large under the new leadership of Secretary General.
授業方法: This class will be held in seminar/lecture style. Resource person(s) would encourage students for active class discussion in focusing on selected topics. Students' presentation would be requested in each module. The course will be taught by UN and other international practitioners and experts with hands-on experience in development.

Middle- Income Trap:
Recently, the newly coined term middle-income trap has been widely used by policy makers to refer to the economies that seem to be stuck in the middle-income range. The discussion in the class include the examination of the middle-income trap hypothesis and the identification of the variables that could alter growth.
